[<!--](url) This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

General bitcoin questions and/or support requests are best directed to the Bitcoin StackExchange at https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com.

For reporting security issues, please read instructions at https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/.

If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, please ensure your hardware is stable by running memtest and observe CPU temperature with a load-test tool such as linpack before creating an issue! -->

<!-- Describe the issue -->The funds I sent ended up being 10% of the original fund. Transactions id show the sent BTC with an extra O, making it 90% lower

**Expected [behavior*](url
[](url)365mnwYhY1sgSAaCK8sZdkjbV2DgBmQuds 3.7972
Amount sent: 3.7972 mBTC
8b3c6312f7a1aea3b58ad9463665c16f765bbde2b545c4c55ee4e4b4c93d08c: 0 1E9BXkrmYjM2psCW9bDYz68SUFmxJSXrZC 2.73045
4a2a45c4ff2b29d2b70c7e37d1df6eb7d74aaf59fe7d70ea108742a8f0604f31: 0 1E9BXkrmYjM2psCW9bDYz68SUFmxJSXrZC 1.05657
bbcb7dd6baa5f90b6fc8b65110b8bc58899fa86a0c110f2876fded2503f70c8a: 0 1E9BXkrmYjM2psCW9bDYz68SUFmxJSXrZC 0.29692
2021-02-21 23:22 to computer -4.08394 -4.08394
365mnwYhY1sgSAaCK8sZdkjbV2DgBmQuds, the address shows 10% of the deposit
Transaction ID shows both 10% of the sum
5619c756e56b2773e9ab73718c4c548ab7cc8c7c954468ef32d944c469c8f443
dennatrasaktions id shows nothing at all
b399b7da48a8e2693a31e7a3e2638efb9a5f19e27f2562ce2d7e7c021970959f
Something must have gone wrong I can not afford to lose SEK 16,000
I hope you can arrange the matter or show me who I should turn to.
If you need more information, I will try to arrange them.
This year the only time something went wrong, 16,000 errors.
With hope for a quick Solution Micke Lyng.
[[)](url](url)
[electrumknastxt.txt](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/files/6022339/electrumknastxt.txt)
)

<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->Get The Total fund, not 10%


**Actual behavior**

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

**To reproduce**

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->I can possibly produce screenshots of tis strange process, I'm a noob so what's obvious to You is "Sanskrit" to Me , but I'll do my best

**System information**

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->Blockchain. info

Microsoft Windows 10 Pro (64 bitar)

title: Funds disappering
